Hadoop environment you probably have
scaled up this environment to be as big

more memory optimized type of instances
and so when you think of ways to start

really powerful from a cost perspective
as well an EMR took this one step

another mechanism for saving costs on

historically an AWS when you spun up a
node or a cluster you could assign a
role to it and that role had certain
permissions to access different data
sets or other services but generally
speaking if someone could execute within
that environment they would be able to
execute as the root Hadoop context
essentially so whatever permission that
cluster had that user would have the
same permissions when their job executed
on this new context concept within EMR
FS allows you to have the jobs that
individuals are submitting in a
kerberized cluster to execute within a
particular role context so to put that
in a simpler simpler terms if I submit
if Brad submits a job you can say if the
user Brad or a group that Brad's a
member of submits a job execute it with
the role such as analytics prod or
analytics dev and so their job will
execute in that context and only have
the permissions that that role grants
them and other jobs executing in that
same cluster can actually have distinct
roles so you can have one shared cluster
that can actually execute with different
permission sets based on the user that's
